docs.title: Technical Writing Samples
docs.text: This site is built using MkDocs and the Material theme. It showcases documentation work I've done in support of MD Student News for Indiana University School of Medicine and serves as a live example of my technical writing, Markdown formatting, and documentation architecture skills.

docs.title: 1.  Navigate to Email Studio
docs.text:
• Click Email Studio in the main menu.
  • Select Content.
  • Open the folder labeled with the upcoming newsletter date.

docs.title: 2. Edit the Newsletter Draft
docs.text:
• Open the newsletter document in the folder.
  • Begin editing as needed.

docs.title: 3. Insert Content
docs.text: • Add the approved submissions from the editorial calendar into the newsletter draft.

docs.title: Weekly Newsletter
docs.text: Send every Monday at 5:30 PM ET. We send out six separate versions of the email:

docs.title: Stakeholders Version (One email)
docs.text:
Exception Not sent between Christmas and New Year and reduced number of emails between June and July due to lack of entries. Faculty & Staff Data Extensions 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>Stakeholders
|          |Core MSE Stakeholders_08_31_22
           |Faculty and Staff Subscribe Form-Student Newsletter

Publication List: MD Student News Stakeholders.

docs.title: Phase-Specific Versions (Four Emails)
docs.text:
Important We don’t want students to unsubscribe, so these emails should use the transactional template. Phase 1 Year 1 Data Extension 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |P1Y1_Class of 2029_0725
Phase 1 Year 2 Data Extension 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |P1Y2_Class of 2028_072825
Phase 2 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |P1Y2_Class of 2027_072925
Phase 3 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |P1Y2_Class of 2026_072925

Publication list: MD Student Events

docs.title: LOA Version (One Email)
docs.text:
• LOAs are a special case and will need their own version of the email, which will be the stakeholder version with all phase info included. However, we don’t want the students to unsubscribe, so use the transactional template.
LOA 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |LOAs_0825

Publication List: MD Student News Students.

docs.title: Weekly Events
docs.text:
Send every Tuesday at 3:00 PM ET.

Exception Not sent between Christmas and New Year and reduced number of emails between June and July due to lack of entries.

Template: Commercial template

Publication List: Student Events

Student Data Extensions 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>AY 2025-2026  
|          |P1Y1_Class of....
|          |P1Y2_Class of....
|          |P2_Class of....
|          |P3_Class of....

Faculty & Staff Data Extensions 
├─>Data Extension
| └─>IN-MED
|    └─>MD Student News Events
|       └─>Stakeholders
|          |Core MSE Stakeholders_08_31_22
           |Faculty and Staff Subscribe Form-Student Newsletter

docs.title: Organize Email Submissions
docs.text:
• Open the MDS News inbox.

  • Create a folder for each week's edition, using a clear naming convention.

YYYY-MM-DD Edition

Example: _2025-07-22 Edition_
  • Drag and drop submissions into the appropriate weekly folder.

docs.title: Handling Repeat Submissions
docs.text:
• If a submission needs to be repeated in a future edition:
  • Add the item to the editorial calendar for the desired week.
  • Move a copy of the submission to that week's folder.

docs.title: Check for Updates
docs.text:
• Review all auto-responses carefully.
  • Look for any updates or revisions that may be hidden within automatic replies.

docs.title: Login
docs.text: • Go to MD Student News SharePoint.

docs.title: Create a New News Post
docs.text:
• Click + New
  • Select News Post

docs.title: Select a template
docs.text:
• Choose the Blank template
  • You can add a header image later

docs.title: Create Post
docs.text: • Create Post

docs.title: Add a title
docs.text:
• Enter a title
  • Avoid punctuation such as ;, :, and -

docs.title: Set the author
docs.text:
• Replace your name with mdsnews@iu.edu
  • Rare exceptions: you may use the actual author’s name

docs.title: Add the article text
docs.text: • Copy/paste from Microsoft Word with minimal reformatting

docs.title: Turn off comments
docs.text: • Click the slider to off.

docs.title: Configure Post Settings
docs.text:
• Click Page details
  • Click Scheduling
  • Set the schedule for 3:00 PM on the newsletter release day.
  • Select the relevant class year(s)
  • Click Save and close

docs.title: Final Step
docs.text:
• Add the page link to the Editorial Calendar**
  • This is how we track all published stories and share with stakeholders

docs.title: In Sitecore
docs.text: Going forward Sitecore will only be used on rare occassions. For most of our submissions we will use Sharepoint instead.

docs.title: 1. Click through the following:
docs.text:
├─> IU 
│  └─> IU-SOM 
│     └─> Home 
│        └─> Blog 
│           └─> md-student-news 
│              └─> 2025 
│                 └─> Blog Article

docs.title: 2. Enter the Article Title.
docs.text: • Avoid using punctionation such as ; , :, and -

docs.title: 3. Write a short teaser
docs.text: • I try to do no more than a single sentence

docs.title: 4. Paste in the content
docs.text: • From a formatting-stripped document like Notepad

docs.title: 5. Make minor edits as needed
docs.text: • Major edits should be handled by the Communications Specialist

docs.title: 6. Add the following Metadata
docs.text:
• Author: Medical Student Education
  • Categories: MD Student News
  • Tags: MD Students, All Campuses

docs.title: 8. Publish the page
docs.text: • You may need to wait on Strategic Communications approval for items to get published

docs.title: Application Access
docs.text: For most of these applications, access can be requested by emailing the listed contacts. Salesforce, however, requires completion of an online tutorial before access is granted.

docs.title: Contacts for Access and Help:
docs.text: LiveWhale: Lynn Boak Salesforce: See instructions below Smartsheet & SharePoint: Joel Smith Sitecore: Alyssa Geisler

docs.title: Salesforce Access
docs.text: To request access to Salesforce Marketing Cloud, follow the steps below:

docs.title: Navigate to the access portal
docs.text: • Go to Salesforce Marketing Cloud User Guide

docs.title: Locate the access request form
docs.text: • Scroll down to the Getting access to Marketing Cloud section.

docs.title: Open the request form
docs.text: • Click on Submit an access request form, then select the User access request form button.

docs.title: Complete the form as follows:
docs.text: Field Entry / Selection Username Enter your IU username (without @iu.edu) Request Type Request Access Include Communication Module Access (Marketing Cloud) Yes Requested IU Units 7325516 (IN-MED-MSE) User Type Communications User Only Requested Data Populations Leave all boxes unchecked

docs.title: Complete compliance requirements
docs.text:
• Click on each of the Agreements and Tutorials and complete them.

  • Once completed, use the dropdown to select: >“I have completed all required compliance tutorials and agreements.”

docs.title: Submit your request
docs.text: • Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Submit.

docs.title: Follow-up training
docs.text: • You may receive a follow-up email from IU’s CRM team with required trainings. Please complete them as instructed.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
To outline roles and usage of key applications utilized in the creation, management, and publication of content for MD Student News.

Publishing Tools Overview Application Purpose Usage LiveWhale Event management and promotion Submit and manage event listings Salesforce Marketing Cloud Newsletter creation and distribution Schedule and send newsletters SharePoint Internal newsletter drafting and publication Draft and edit newsletter content Sitecore Major story drafting and publication Draft and edit newsletter content Smartsheet Content planning and scheduling Assign publish dates and owners

docs.title: Branding guidelines
docs.text:
Branding & Guidelines

To learn more about the IU branding guidelines visit the Indiana University Branding Guide. Below is just a sample of some of the guidelines

Examples Dates
  • It is Sept. 4 or September 4, not September 4th or Sept. 4th.
  • Preferably abbreviate the month if it's a full date: Sept. 4, 2024.
  • Usually spell it out if not a full date: September 4.
  • I make exceptions for this when I put dates in headlines, to keep headlines at a manageable length.
  • If the date for something is in the same year you’re in (say, 2024), you don’t need to list the year.
Times
  • It is not 12 pm. It is Noon or noon.
  • AP style says we should be doing it like this: 9 a.m. ET. But it seems that the standard here is 9 am ET—no periods—so just keep doing that.
  • You don’t need to put zeros after a time, so use: 9 am ET instead of 9:00 am ET.
  • On that note, be sure to note the time zone in everything. I’d prefer just to make it ET in all references.
Headlines
  • Much to my chagrin, Strat Comm wants headlines in sentence case. So a headline would be: “Nick disagrees with Strat Comm team” not “Nick Disagrees with Strat Comm Team.”
  • If you’re posting a blog on the website for MD Student News and it is a phase-specific item, put that in the headline so they know it’s an item for their attention: “Phase 3: Select Transitions 3 track today”
Exception Events for the calendar. Title case is fine for those, as they are the proper noun names of the events. Call to Action
  • We get a lot of submissions that have no calls to action: “Phase 2 scheduling guidelines.” It doesn’t tell the reader what to do with it.
  • It doesn’t seem like a big deal, but it really helps to make that explicit: “Class of 2027: Read more about upcoming Phase 2 scheduling guidelines.”

There are some helpful lists online that you can print out that offer lots of call-to-action verbs.

Titles
  • As you know, we put the person’s academic credentials after their name on first reference: Nick McLain, MD, PhD.
  • On second reference (and third, fourth, etc.), just use their last name—even if they’re a doctor. Don’t put “Dr. McLain wrote this…” – just say “McLain wrote this…”
  • When using someone's job title, capitalize it only when it appears before their name: Communications Specialist Nick McLain
  • Do not capitalize it when used after their name: Nick McLain, communications specialist, said that…

<!--Test Code>

To learn more about the IU branding guidelines visit the Indiana University Branding Guide . Below is just a sample of some of the guidelines.

docs.title: Go to the Livewhale Events Calendar
Enter event information
docs.text:
Enter the data from the email into the same fields in LiveWhale.

Event Metadata
  • Title
  • Date & Time
  • Brief Summary
  • Location
  • Details
  • Online Event
  • Event Type
  • Audience
  • Campus
  • Tags
  • Contact Information
  • Event Cost

docs.title: Team
docs.text:
• Nick McLain - Commmunications Specialist
  • Joel Smith - Curriculum Data Coordinator/Comms Backup
  • Trace Leapley - Multimedia Specialist

docs.title: After Submission
docs.text: • You will be notified by CAITS once the new phone number has been assigned.

docs.title: Notify the Employee
docs.text:
1. Send the assigned phone number to the employee.
  2. Instruct the employee to complete the 911 Acknowledgement.
Important The assigned phone number will not be activated until the employee completes the 911 Acknowledgement form.
  1. Share the link to the 911 Acknowledgement Form

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
To document the the step-by-step process for setting up a new employee's workspace.

  • Assigning technology
  • Assisting with initial log-in.
  • Providing printer access, and assigning a phone number.

docs.title: Responsibilities
docs.text: Role: Curriculum Data Coordinator Primary Responsibility: Oversee and complete all onboarding workspace setup tasks.

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text: Onboarding The action or process of integrating a new employee into an organization. HTS Number The number HTS generated to identify and track employee laptops. S/T(Service Tag) The alphanumeric code determines when a laptop warranty expires. Eduroam The standard Wi-Fi connection on the Indiana University Campus, IU Indianapolis, Regional Campuses, and many other universities in the United States and worldwide.

docs.title: Setting Up New Employee Workspace
docs.text:
1. Prepare Office Space

  2. Ensure the following equipment is available in the new employee's office:

    • Two monitors
    • Docking station
    • Mouse and keyboard
    • Web camera
    • Speaker

  3. Device Connectivity

  4. Verify that all devices connect and are operational.

docs.title: Assign a Computer to a New Employee
docs.text:
1. Confirm Equipment Information.
  2. Verify the HTS number with the new employee (indicated by the red label).
  3. Confirm the Service Tag (ST #) with the new employee.
  4. Update Lifecycle Tracking.
  5. Enter and confirm user and laptop information in the Lifecycle Tracking Guide. Access the guide via the designated platform.

docs.title: Assisting New Employees with Initial Log-In
docs.text:
Connect Laptop to Eduroam

  1. Initial Log-In Steps
  2. Instruct the employee to:
    • Select the Wi-Fi icon positioned at the bottom right corner of the screen. Log into the eduroam server using their full email address as the username.
    • Enter the password.
    • Return to the main login screen and log in using only their username and password.
  3. Verification
  4. Ensure that the employee has successfully logged into their laptop.

docs.title: Granting Printer Access to New Employees
docs.text:
See [[printersetup]] for more information

!!! note If the employee still does not have access, after setup, contact htshelp@iu.edu for assistance.

docs.title: Assigning a Phone Number to a New Employee
docs.text:
1. Access Telecom Services Request
    • Navigate to Telecom Services Request.
  2. Complete Service Request
    • Click on Internal Services Requests.
    • Select Internal to IU.
  3. Initiate a Teams Calls Service Request
  4. Click on Teams Calls Service Request.

  5. Fill out the Teams Calls Service Request with the following values.

    Field Entry Submitted For Another User Account Number 1280098 Campus IN-Indianapolis New phone number needed? Yes Equipment No - We just use headsets USB Type Only required if requesting a phone Equipment Delivery Only required if requesting a phone Details Include building and office/cubicle number

  6. Click Submit.

docs.title: Phone Number Assignment & 911 Acknowledgement
docs.text: 1. You will be notified by CAITS once the new phone number has been assigned.

docs.title: Notify the Employee
docs.text:
1. Send the assigned phone number to the employee.
  2. Instruct the employee to complete the 911 Acknowledgement using one of the methods below:

Important: Activation Delayed Until Complete

The assigned phone number will not be activated until the employee completes the 911 Acknowledgement form.

Direct Link:

  • Visit the 911 Acknowledgement Form.
Disclaimer This document uses the Benton Sans typeface in accordance with Indiana University branding standards. For full branding guidelines, please visit the Indiana University Branding Page. © 2025 Joel R. Smith. All rights reserved.

docs.title: Assign a Computer to a New Employee
Confirm Equipment Information
docs.text:
• Verify the HTS number with the new employee (indicated by the red label).
  • Confirm the Service Tag (S/T #) with the new employee.

docs.title: Update Lifecycle Tracking
docs.text: • Enter and confirm user and laptop information in the Lifecycle Tracking Guide via Smartsheet.

docs.title: Assisting New Employees with Initial Log-In
Initial Log-In Steps
docs.text:
• Instruct the employee to:
    • Select the Wi-Fi icon at the bottom right.
    • Log into eduroam using their full email address as the username.
    • Enter their password.
    • Return to the main login screen and log in using only their username and password.

docs.title: Verification
docs.text: • Ensure that the employee has successfully logged into their laptop.

docs.title: Assisting New Employees with Initial Log-In
1.  Ask the employee to:
docs.text: • Click the Wi-Fi icon at the bottom right of the screen.

docs.title: 2. Select the eduroam network
docs.text: Log into Eduroam using: Username: Full email address    Password: Their network password

docs.title: 3. After connecting to the wifi
docs.text:
• return to the main login screen
Log into the laptop, using: Username: Username only Password: Their network password

docs.title: 4. Verify Successful Log-In
docs.text:
• Confirm the employee has successfully logged into their laptop.
  • Check to make sure that the computer is preparing windows for the new user.

docs.title: Assigning a Phone Number to a New Employee
docs.text:
1. Access Telecom Services Request

  2. Navigate to the Telecom Services Request portal.

  3. Complete Internal Services Request

  4. Click Internal Services Requests

  5. Select Internal to IU

  6. Initiate a Teams Calls Service Request

  7. Click on Teams Calls Service Request

  8. Fill out the form with the following values:

    Field Entry Submitted For Another User Account Number 1280098 Campus IN-Indianapolis New phone number needed? Yes Equipment No - We just use headsets USB Type Only required if requesting a phone Equipment Delivery Only required if requesting a phone Details Include building and office/cubicle number

  9. Click Submit

docs.title: IU Print: Printing, Scanning, and Copying Guide
1. From Your Computer
docs.text:
• Open the Print screen in your application.
  • Choose your printer:
  • Black & White: IU Campus BW Printer
  • Color: IU Campus Color Printers
  • Click Print.

docs.title: 2. At the Printer
docs.text:
• Go to the workroom printer.
  • Tap your Crimson Card on the card reader (look for the sticker or post-it note near the printer model number).
  • Wait a few seconds for your information to load.
  • Your print jobs will appear on the screen.
  • Select the items you want to print.
  • Tap Print All.
  • When finished, log out by:
  • Pressing Logout (bottom left), or
  • Tapping the circle icon with an image.

docs.title: Mobile Printing
docs.text: • Visit: [https://mobile.print.iu.edu/myprintcenter/](https://mobile.print.iu.edu/myprintcenterter and tap your Crimson Card to release the job.

docs.title: 3. Choose Copy or Scan:
docs.text: • Select High Quality or Low Quality.

docs.title: 4. Scanned files will be emailed to you shortly.
5. When finished, log out:
docs.text:
• Press Logout, or
  • Tap the circle icon with an image.

docs.title: Installing IU Printers on Your Device
Windows
docs.text:
1. Download the installer from IUware.
  2. Filename: IU Campus Queues_for_x64.exe
  3. If prompted by SmartScreen:
  4. Click More info → Run anyway.
  5. Click Install, then Finish.
  6. When printing:
  7. Choose IU Campus Black & White Printer or IU Campus Color Printer.
  8. Enter your IU username when prompted.

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
1. Download the installer from [IUware](https://iuiversal_IU_Print_Popup_v1.3.dmg`.
  2. Run Popup.pkg.
  3. Click Continue → Continue → Install.
  4. Enter your admin credentials if prompted.
  5. After installation:
  6. Print using Universal_IU_Print.
  7. To print in color: go to Printer Options → Color Settings → Color.
  8. Enter your IU username when prompted.

docs.title: If the Printer Doesn’t Show Up
Windows
docs.text:
• Connect to IU Network (Eduroam or wired).
  • Restart or log off/on.
  • Open File Explorer and paste: \\universal.print.iu.edu\Universal_IU_Print
  • Open Software Center and install the Universal IU Print app.

docs.title: Mac
docs.text:
• Open Self Service (make sure you're logged in).
  • Install the Universal IU Print app.

docs.title: Mobile
docs.text: • Go to https://mobile.print.iu.edu.

docs.title: Step 2: Release the Print Job
docs.text:
• Visit any UIUP printer.
  • Tap your Crimson Card on the card reader.
  • Select specific jobs or Print All.
  • Jobs remain in the queue for 24 hours.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: Email: printing@iu.edu

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
To document the step-by-step process for setting up a new employee's workspace.

  • Assigning technology
  • Assisting with initial log-in
  • Providing printer access
  • Assigning a phone number

docs.title: Responsibilities
docs.text: Role: Curriculum Data Coordinator Primary Responsibility: Oversee and complete all onboarding workspace setup tasks.

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
Onboarding The action or process of integrating a new employee into an organization. HTS Number The number HTS generated to identify and track employee laptops. S/T (Service Tag) The alphanumeric code that determines when a laptop warranty expires. Eduroam The standard Wi-Fi connection on Indiana University campuses and many other institutions worldwide.

Disclaimer: This document uses the Benton Sans typeface in accordance with Indiana University branding standards. For full branding guidelines, please visit the IU School of Medicine Communications Office Branding Page.

docs.title: Setting Up New Employee Workspace
docs.text:
1. Prepare Office Space Ensure the following equipment is available in the new employee's office:
  2. Two monitors
  3. Docking station
  4. Mouse and keyboard
  5. Web camera

  6. Speaker

  7. Device Connectivity Verify that all devices connect and are operational.
